page.title: 11CLOG MAKING IN LEEK
page.content: My Dad makes clogs,his shop is in Derby Street. He has been making them for about 20 years.He gets the leather and wood from firms,then he nails the leather shoe piece onto the beech wood sole. One pair costs 24.95 pounds.He sells them mostly to farmers.He used to sell them to dye house workers,but now they wear wellington boots or 'docks'.Metal tips are nailed onto soles and heels to give them a longer life. A man named Bill Wood used to make clogs before my Dad.He had a small shop on the bottom corner of Pickwood Road on the site of the new Normid.
